name: Hilton Lexington Downtown

reviews.text: I stay here whenever I'm in Lexington on business, which is several times each year. The staff are incredibly friendly and always remember me, even when it's been several months between stays. I love the renovations, appreciate the shuttle pick up at the airport, and enjoy the restaurant, too!
reviews.title: Have stayed repeatedly - great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at the Hilton Lexington Downtown, and chose this hotel because of the location and because it was listed as "pet-friendly." The hotel itself was fine - a pretty standard Hilton in most ways. The personnel were very friendly and helpful, and the entire place has recently undergone a major renovation. Our room looked brand new. While I liked the Sleep Number bed (We sleep on one at home.) I'm not sure it's the best choice for a hotel. Because the Sleep Number has electronic controls, it provides just another thing to "go wrong" with a room. In other words, the more "gadgets" you have in a hotel room, the more likely that something won't be working right. Like another poster, I had a problem with my bed adjustment as well - and since I have one at home, I don't think it was "operator error." At any rate, the bed was set on the level of firmness that I like, so it wasn't really a problem for me.
reviews.title: Newly Renovated, Good Service, But Not Really Pet Friendly

reviews.text: We had a drink in the bar, and they were very busy, but the service was friendly and efficient, although they could have used some more help. If you like interesting beers, you really should try the Kentucky Bourbon Barrel Ale. I had never had it before, and it's not something I would drink a lot of, but it was quite interesting and tasty.
reviews.title: Don't ask for help from the staff

reviews.text: We also ordered late-night room service, and I must say that it was probably one of the better late-night room service meals I've ever had.
reviews.title: Executive Level is the way to go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only major complaint is the pet fee they charge, in order to bring your dog to the hotel. I must admit that my disappointment is largely my fault. The Hilton website for this hotel clearly states that they allow pets for a $100 fee, so I can't complain about being surprised. I hadn't checked that site. I simply noted that the hotel's summary info online indicated that it was "pet friendly." My surprise came from the fact that I didn't go to the hotel's detailed site and read about the fee, so I can't say that they didn't provide warning, but a $100 fee is outrageous. I understand that, especially when you have a nice, clean, newly-renovated hotel, you want to keep it that way as long as possible, but there must be a better way. Our dog is small, doesn't bark, doesn't chew things and is completely potty-trained, so doesn't make messes. She is also a hypo-allergenic breed that doesn't cause a reaction in people who are allergic to dogs. (That's the justification that most hotels use for charging a pet fee - they say that due to allergies in some guests, they must take extra steps in cleaning a room in which a dog has stayed, even if there is no mess.) I don't expect to have the dog stay without a fee, even though, in our case, the dog's impact on the room and other guests is non-existent, but I have a hard time believing that any "extra cleaning" amounts to $100. Are they really going to put an extra $100 of effort into that room? I seriously doubt that they did anything to our room after we checked out that they wouldn't have done otherwise. What it really amounts to, is that they don't want dogs in their hotel, but they still want to list themselves as "pet friendly," so they set their fee so high that it keeps guests with dogs away. And it would have worked on me too, if I had noticed the amount of the fee at the time of booking.
reviews.title: Great location, clean room, friendly staff free parking

reviews.text: Booked thru Priceline $39. Conveniently located in downtown Lexington. I had a low floor room with a great view of the park and fountain across the street. Was in this property over a weekend and found ample street parking. Staff is friendly and the food in the restaurant was well prepared and presented. I had the 1/4 chicken 'cause I didn't want to go out into the rain. It was good!
reviews.title: Barely holding on to their franchise.....

reviews.text: The gym has much to be desired. the recumbent bike was broken. One of the 3 treadmills had operational issue. The free weights were terribly limited. The hotel offers a $10 day pass to a nice Urban Active one block away. It's a nice small club. If I were to be at the Hilton for any length of time I'd pay the fee.
reviews.title: remodeled-renewed

reviews.text: According to the front desk staff some of the rooms have been remodeled. Not mine. I had to place a rolled up towel between the mattress and box sprigs to make it level. That seemed to remedy the problem. The upholstery on the chair in my room was frayed...as were the curtains. The bathroom was certainly not Hilton status. Hope they get to that room soon!
reviews.title: Go stay at a Holiday Inn!

reviews.text: For the price I paid it was a good buy. I'd stay here again, but never at their rack rate.
reviews.title: Good location, good value
Lexington New Years Eve
reviews.text: Just finished 5 nights at this remodeled property. The rooms, lobby, and common areas all have been redone and my worries from previous reviews were quickly erased. Sure the bath areas are still small but updated. The beds were fine, carpets and furniture were all clean and new. The common areas such as bar and restaurant were upscale and provided more than average service and quality products.. If you need a ride, their shuttle/concierge gentleman Gary will take expert care of you. A stay that I can say was above ordinary because of the kind and helpful staff in addition to the warm surroundings. Enjoy and relax at this downtown property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect hotel to stay at while attending a UK basketball or football. Nice clean rooms, comfortable beds. Nice breakfast buffet (at an additional cost). Free parking. Great location. Have stayed here many times and never any issues.
reviews.title: Very nice hotlel.. Great location

reviews.text: It's been many years since I stayed at the Hilton Downtown Lexington... So I wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Very nice room overlooking Triangle Park.

reviews.text: The lobby and rooms all appeared newly renovated, fresh and modern. The front desk personnel were efficient and cheerful. Parking was free in the attached garage. The rooms were large and well appointed.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.text: My secret tip: Ask for a room overlooking the park. The view is awesome!
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight for business. Paid $214 (with taxes). No wifi (extra $), no breakfast, nothing special (parking was free for guests). Rooms were clean, but looked tired. No issues with staff, all helpful. Nice workout room, sleep comfort beds, and pool/spa. Location was great for my purpose, but I just expected more for a Hilton. Many local bars and restaurants nearby. I'm sure it is a great place to stay for the basketball games. Next time I'll stay at the Hampton Inn on the edge of town for 1/2 the cost with twice the services.
reviews.title: Best location - right next to Rupp Arena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the downtown Hilton before going to the races at Keeneland.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in ideal location...

reviews.text: The free parking is a bonus in such a central location to downtown restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Getting better and the kinks are worked out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wearrived from Nashville at 12, allowed early check in and stowed our gear.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel (with a couple glitches)

reviews.text: Decent size rooms, somewhat small bathroom, all in newly renovated condition.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Sleep number beds were nice, more of an inconvienence to my husband as I couldn't find my"number", but very restful eventually.
reviews.title: Did not enjoy

reviews.text: I have been a Hilton Honor member for 20 plus years and this is one of the few left that has a hospitality floor for Honors members, serving breakfast and hors d'oeuvres. The gentleman working the evening manager's reception and the lady doing breakfast could not have been more gracious and accomodating. The Honors floor room was huge and looked to have brand new everything. It wasn't perfect, the power went out which killed the internet and room service suffered, but this was out of the control of the hotel. The manager even called to see if I was OK. The fitness room could use a few more dumbells and less machines but it was still very functional. The bed was very comfortable so who cares if it was a Sleep Number? I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but there were lots of good restaurants in the neighborhood. If I'm ever in the area again I'll be looking forward to staying here again.
reviews.title: They treat Honors members great

reviews.text: This is the second and the last time I stay at this "hotel". I had two conferences this Spring in Lexington and I had to stay there. What can I say? Everything is bad. This dump is dirty, they are rude and they also charged me for three nights instead of only two. I called them and they lie. The "restaurants"...come on..., the food is horrible and the price is for a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Motel not hotel, dirty,rude people, overcharged

reviews.text: This hotel is going through major renovations and there is dirt everywhere and it is smelly.
reviews.title: WOW!!! Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: This is worse than a cheap motel on the side of the road.
reviews.title: Great location - looks nice - still needs some internal work

reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel! The Hilton Lexington Downtown has an awesome staff - very friendly, attentive and welcoming. We stayed here before but it's like being in a completely different hotel with the amazing renovations. From the artsy waterfall in the lobby to the cozy club room to crispy clean rooms - NOT the same place we stayed in before. And the new restaurant has delicious foods - definitely save room for dessert. We recommend the Bailey Cheesecake and Sweet Biscut desserts - YUMMO!!! And the location is great as it's right downtown near everything. We could not have asked for a better stay and look forward to our next visit. This is THE place to stayat in Lexington!
reviews.title: Convenience in Lexington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed with my stay at this hotel, stayed 2 nights for a wedding. The location was great, especially since we did not have a car. However both mornings we had a do not disturb sign hung on our door knob, and both mornings house keeping came barging into our room waking us up. the Breakfast was terrible, our friends down the hall from us had a broken sleep number bed, our dresser was broken as was our safe and our closet door. Also there isn't much of a noise buffer between rooms, the room next to us had their tv on and it kept us up most of the night. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. But I would most definitely not stay here again, for the amount of money they make in one day there were far to many things in disrepair. Make sure to bring a big bottle of lotion, the water was very drying.
reviews.title: unsatisfied

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel to attend our friend's wedding for a long weekend. The location was just so perfect, right in the center of downtown Lexington and you could walk to many restaurants and bars. It was nice and quiet as well, the darkening curtain closed very tightly so my 4 year-old son could sleep in without getting disturbed by the morning sun light (important for parents with young kids, right ;))
reviews.title: Convenient Hotel in Downtown Lexington

reviews.text: Staff at the hotel was all so friendly and welcomed us wholeheartedly. Breakfast buffet had a huge selection and was awesome.
reviews.title: September conference

reviews.text: Stayed here five nights for a conference. Great value and excellent service. Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. Food at conference was very good for "hotel food". Very friendly and helpful staff. I was impressed that use of the business center was free, including document printing. Free wifi as well. Free shuttle to and from the airport on the hour and half hour. Across the street from Rupp Arena. Lots of historic and bourbon related touring nearby if you have time, including Shaker village, Berea and Bardstown.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in central location

reviews.text: I stayed for 7 nights when I attended a conference. I thought the hotel was great - rooms were very clean and a good size (2 adults). They had sleep number beds (which were interesting to experience). We got free parking in the multi level garage next door (what a pleasant change to have free parking!). Drinks at the bar were reasonably priced, the food we ordered at the bar was great. Service at the reception desk was no problem. The only issue I had was the fact the rooms did not have a small fridge - you have to remember to ask for one when you check in.
reviews.title: Nice hotel located in the heart of downtown

reviews.text: The Hilton Lexington Downtown continues its consistent performance. The staff are attentive and welcoming, the rooms are nicely decorated, and everything is clean. This time, it was wonderfully decorated for the holidays.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay!

reviews.text: I go to Lexington for our Christmas Party every year and since it is at the Hilton I decided to stay there instead of the Hyatt this year. I reserved a smoking room well in advance and received confirmation. Upon checking in I was immediately informed that I would not get a smoking room that thirty reservations had been taken for the five available. When I asked what accommodation could be made as I made a resevation not a request, I was told about the $250 fee if I smoked. I said fine and took my girlfriend to look at the fountain that is such a beautiful part of the decor but it was not working. When we went to our room we discovered there was no refrigerator and that our sleep number bed would not inflate although it did make a lot of noise like it was trying to. Upon check out no one seemed to be sure what I needed to do to not pay parking. I went to their site upon arriving home and left them a message expaining all of this but never received a response. I will stay across the street next time.
reviews.title: Not Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with the size of our standard room with two queen beds. The rooms were very clean, with excellent lighting. The hotel has free covered parking and an excellent restaurant for all meals with a good menu and great food. In addition the rooms have the sleep number beds if you are a fan of those. I wasn't excited about them. If you are there for a game it has a walkway to Rupp Arena that keeps you from having to go out into the elements to get there. We were there for two full days and was able to walk to different restaurants for each meal all within a block of the hotel. Like most Hiltons they also have a business room that gives you computers with free internet service which it seems like a lot of chains are going to a pay system. Overall very pleased with this Hilton
reviews.title: Convenient location with spacious rooms

reviews.text: I've stayed at this Radisson/Hilton nearly 20 times over the last few years. Usually it is top notch. However this time I was surprised by a used ice bucket when I went to get ice. Definitely not good!
reviews.title: Used, melted water in ice bucket - Not Good...

reviews.text: I've said many times, that it's the little things that count. The Lexington Downtown Hilton missed this one! If I paid 60 bucks for the room, I could deal with it. However, I am a Hilton Gold Member and find melted water in the ice bucket upon check in. This is unacceptable.
reviews.title: Great Location for a Lexington Visit

reviews.text: As has been mentioned, Hilton bought this property from Radisson. It needs work to become a Hilton, and it was apparent that extensive remodeling is going on. The carpeting and tile was clean but very worn, with burnholes in places. The ceiling had that "cinderblock look", and the wallcovering looked cheap. Pictures were attractive and the bed linen was fresh and new. There were workmen in the rooms down the hall so a change is coming.
reviews.title: A Work in Progress

reviews.text: Parking was not friendly, and very confusing. A zillion spaces have been set aside for valet parking, so you can't park anywhere near the entrance to the Hilton from the garage, if you don't care to use valet parking. I ended up two floors up from the entrance and had to take a filthy elevator to the entrance. After I checked in, I was advised that parking is free to Hilton guests which was a nice compensation.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better experience!

description: Lexington Kentucky’s finest hotel, Hilton Lexington/Downtown, is the hotel destination of choice for meetings and weddings, alike. Centrally located in downtown Lexington and adjacent to Rupp Arena, Hilton Lexington/Downtown is just minutes away from Blue Grass Airport, Keeneland Race Track, University of Kentucky, the Kentucky Horse Park and the corporate offices of Lexmark and Ashland Oil.
